intro: Baphia dewevrei subsp. marquesii, commonly known as the Marquesa baphia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the island's tropical forests. Its botanical features include a slender stem, trifoliate leaves, and pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
